abstract: Gov Matt Bevin issues executive order stating Kentucky marriage licenses no longer need to include names of county clerks in effort to protect their religious beliefs; decision was influenced by arrest of Rowan County clerk Kim Davis in September for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same sex couples; additional executive orders described.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Matt Bevin ordered the state to prepare marriage licenses that omit county clerks’ names, to protect elected officials’ religious beliefs.

headline.main: Kentucky: Marriage Licenses Will No Longer List Clerks’ Names
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: Marriage Licenses Will No Longer List Clerks’ Names

snippet: Gov. Matt Bevin ordered the state to prepare marriage licenses that omit county clerks’ names, to protect elected officials’ religious beliefs.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
